intro: Brickelliastrum, commonly known as brickellbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their woody stems and showy, yellow or orange flowers. The leaves are usually opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Brickelliastrum species are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making them resilient to drought and heat.
